pullRequest.title: Add predicate support to accumulation checker
pullRequest.bodyText:
Differences from predicate support in the object construction checker:

sensible LUB/GLB between predicate annotations
subtyping between predicates does not use implication (because I didn't want a dependency on an SMT solver), so it conservatively underapproximates
unicode support in identifiers
no dependency on an external parsing library other than JavaParser, which the CF already depends on

nodes.bodyText:
BugInCF is only for bugs in the Checker Framework itself.  This looks more like it should be a UserError.  Or, pass the exception up to the caller.
Please check all the uses of BugInCF.
Why not give the superclass the opportunity to issue more errors, if there are others?

commit.message: Merge branch 'accumulation-predicate' of github.com:kelloggm/checker-framework into accumulation-predicate

nodes.bodyText: Was calling postInit() here before a bug?
Does this mean that after converting the accumulator to a predicate, P must equal that predicate (i.e., it falls into the next case of predicate subtyping)?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -248,6 +320,21 @@ public QualifierHierarchy createQualifierHierarchy(MultiGraphFactory factory) { * | * bottom * + * + * Predicate subtyping is defined as follows: + * + *
    + *
  • An accumulator is a subtype of a predicate if substitution from the accumulator to the + * predicate makes the predicate true. For example, {@code Acc(A)} is a subtype of {@code + * AccPred("A || B")}, because when A is replaced with {@code true} and B is replaced with + * {@code false}, the resulting boolean formula evaluates to true. + *
  • A predicate P is a subtype of an accumulator iff after converting the accumulator into + * a predicate representing the conjunction of its elements, P is a subtype of that

nodes.bodyText: It might be good to document what the "right thing" to do would be, and why we deviate from that.  I think the "right thing" here is logical implication, i.e., P is a subtype of Q iff P implies Q.  But we don't bake in the implication check to keep things simple and minimize dependencies.

commit.message: minor doc improvements suggested by Manu
resolved issues and passed git pre-commit hooks
fixed all-test-jdk8 and all-test-jdk11 jobs in pipeline
Improve naming.  Make switch statements report errors.
Fixed contructor throw RuntimeException and javadoc
remove paragraph on disabling framework support

Rename MaybeThis to UnknownThis.

The name MaybeThis isn't bad, but the rest of the Checker Framework uses
the naming convention "Unknown" for the top type.
Improve Javadoc: add explanations, examples, links
removed frameworkSupport Interface and resolved comments
clean up some logic in type factory
use the merged version of the RR checker
add another test case that checks that RR support works as intended
add all remaining basic OCC tests that are relevant to a general accumulation analysis
add docs and remove debugging code
actually test the accumulate method, too, by making the test checker a very simple CM checker
remove code that should have been deleted
more docs, make Accumulation ATF constructor protected
Merge branch 'accumulation-analysis' of github.com:kelloggm/checker-framework into accumulation-analysis
add draft of manual section for building an accumulation checker
some javadoc that I missed before
improve docs on the tree annotator
make explicit the requirements on the top and bottom types
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:typetools/checker-framework into accumulation-analysis
Comment tweaks and a few logic simplifications
Merge branch 'accumulation-analysis' of github.com:kelloggm/checker-framework into accumulation-analysis
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:typetools/checker-framework into accumulation-analysis
remove the need for a separate top type, and other miscellaneous improvements that go along with that
add defensive logic to AccATF constructor to check that the accumulator annotation matches the requirements
Code review changes, mostly to documentation
efficiency improvements Mike asked for, as best as I can tell
update some comments, add failing test
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:typetools/checker-framework into accumulation-predicate
merge from upstream and resolve conflicts
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:typetools/checker-framework into accumulation-predicate
try to force UTF-8 encoding in my tests

nodes.bodyText: This test case is unrelated to predicates, right?
We probably want some documentation of the unsound handling of negation
